isis.stitle: CAB: DAYCAB AND SLEEPER CAB for ProStar, ProStar Premium, and ProStar Limited Models - REMOVE - CAB DOOR LATCH

svcsubproc.title: Remove Cab Door Latch on Daycab and Sleeper Cab

step1.para:
Remove cab door trim panel, refer to
CAB DOOR TRIM PANEL
. If cab door is equipped with electric door window and locks, refer to Remove Cab Door Trim Panel with Electric Door Window and Locks on Daycab and Sleeper Cab
. If cab door is equipped with manual door window and locks, refer to Remove Cab Door Trim Panel with Manual Door Window and Locks on Daycab and Sleeper Cab.

Remove cab door vapor barrier, refer to
CAB DOOR VAPOR BARRIER
. If cab door is equipped with electric door window and locks, refer to Remove Cab Door Vapor Barrier with Electric Door Window and Locks on Daycab and Sleeper Cab
. If cab door is equipped with manual door window and locks, refer to Remove Cab Door Vapor Barrier with Manual Door Window and Locks on Daycab and Sleeper Cab.

Remove cab door modular door hardware assembly, refer to
MODULAR DOOR HARDWARE ASSEMBLY
. For removing cab door modular door hardware assembly, refer to Remove Cab Door Modular Door Hardware Assembly on Daycab and Sleeper Cab.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 59 for Items in parentheses unless otherwise noted.

step1.para:
With cab door modular door hardware assembly (Item 1, Figure 46)
removed and placed on a suitable work surface. Remove cab door latch (Item 1) from window run channel (Item 2) by pressing the locking tab (Item 3) in and slide hanger support bracket (Item 4) out of window run channel, driver side shown.

figure.caption: Figure 59. Cab Door Latch and Hanger Support Bracket

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 60 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Remove cab door latch (Item 1) from inner cab door handle control rods (Items 2 and 3) by rotating cab door latch down around inner cab door handle control rods and slide it off control rods, driver side shown. Lay it out of the way and save for installation, unless damaged and being replaced.

figure.caption: Figure 60. Cab Door Latch and Inner Cab Door Handle Control Rods

calloutgroup.callout1: 2. INNER CAB DOOR HANDLE CONTROL ROD
3. INNER CAB DOOR HANDLE CONTROL ROD

step1.para: Repeat procedure to remove passenger side cab door latch.
